docs.title: Professor Workflow Documentation
docs.text:
Welcome to the Professor Workflow Documentation. This guide will walk you through the step-by-step process of managing courses, students, and evaluations on the platform.

Use the tabs on the left to navigate through different sections.

docs.title: Managing Courses
docs.text: Professors can manage courses by adding, viewing, editing, and deleting them.

docs.title: Course Management Actions
docs.text:
Add CourseView CourseEdit CourseDelete Course 
Steps:
  - Navigate to the "Courses" section.
  - Click "Add Course".
  - Enter the following mandatory details:
    - Course Code
    - Course Name
    - Start Date
    - End Date
  - Click "Save" to add the course.

Best Practice

Use a standardized course code format for consistency.

Steps:
  - Navigate to the "Courses" section.
  - Click on any course to view details.

Course Information

The course page shows enrolled students, TAs, and exam details.

Steps:
  - Navigate to the "Courses" section.
  - Click "Edit" on a course.
  - Modify details as needed.
  - Click "Save" to update the course.

Caution

Changing the start or end date may affect the exam schedule.

Steps:
  - Navigate to the "Courses" section.
  - Click "Delete" on a course.
  - Confirm the deletion.

Irreversible Action

Deleting a course will remove all associated exams and student records.

Next: Learn how to Manage Students & TAs.

docs.title: Evaluation Process
docs.text: Once students submit their answer sheets, professors can evaluate them manually or using automated grading.

docs.title: Steps to Start Evaluation
docs.text:
Upload Student Answer SheetsGenerate Grading RubricStart Evaluation 
Steps:
  - Navigate to the "Exams" section.
  - Select the exam.
  - Click "Upload Student Answer Sheets".
  - Select and upload scanned answer scripts.

Accepted Formats

PDF format is recommended for clear readability.

Steps:
  - Navigate to the "Exams" section.
  - Select the exam.
  - Click "Generate Grading Rubric".
  - Define marking criteria.
  - Click "Save".

Why Use a Rubric?

A grading rubric ensures fairness and consistency in evaluation.

Steps:
  - Navigate to the "Exams" section.
  - Select the exam.
  - Click "Start Evaluation".
  - Use manual grading or AI-assisted grading.

Grading Options

  • Manual Grading: Professors review each answer manually.
  • AI-Assisted Grading: Automated comparison with the golden answer script.
